title: On many-to-one mappings over finite fields
authors:
Yanbin Zheng and Yanjin Ding and Meiying Zhang and Pingzhi Yuan and
  Qiang Wang
abstract:
The definition of many-to-one mapping, or $m$-to-$1$ mapping for short,
between two finite sets is introduced in this paper, which unifies and
generalizes the definitions of $2$-to-$1$ mappings and $n$-to-$1$ mappings. A
generalized local criterion is given, which is an abstract criterion for a
mapping to be $m$-to-$1$. By employing the generalized local criterion, three
constructions of $m$-to-$1$ mapping are proposed, which unify and generalize
all the previous constructions of $2$-to-$1$ mappings and $n$-to-$1$ mappings.
Then the $m$-to-$1$ property of polynomials $f(x) = x^r h(x^s)$ on
$\mathbb{F}_{q}^{*}$ is studied by using these three constructions. A series of
explicit conditions for~$f$ to be an $m$-to-$1$ mapping on $\mathbb{F}_{q}^{*}$
are found through the detailed discussion of the parameters $m$, $s$, $q$ and
the polynomial $h$. These results extend many conclusions in the literature.
